entry.title: Why WordPress Still Dominates in 2025 â€” and How Top Developers Are Pushing Its Limits
entry.summary: Despite being around for over two decades, WordPress remains one of the most dominant platforms for building websites â€” powering over 40% of all sites on the web. And yet, in developer circles, it often gets unfairly dismissed as â€œjust for bloggersâ€ or â€œnot technical enough.â€ The reality is far more nuanced. ** ** A flexible CMS Quick deployment Scalability Easy content management A wide plugin ecosystem WordPress checks all the boxes. Itâ€™s not about using WordPress because itâ€™s easier. Itâ€™s about using the right tool for the job. Modern WordPress development isnâ€™t just about installing themes and plugins. The top WordPress development companies use advanced techniques like: Custom theme development (often using block-based editing) Performance tuning for Core Web Vitals Building scalable WooCommerce stores API integrations for CRM, ERP, and other business tools Security hardening and automated testing pipelines If you're curious what that kind of high-level work looks like, hereâ€™s a curated list of some of the top WordPress development companies leading the charge in 2024. If you're building a dev business or freelance practice, WordPress gives you: Recurring revenue opportunities (via maintenance, hosting, SEO) A low learning curve with room to scale into complexity A massive client base that already understands the platform And with tools like ACF, CPT UI, Elementor, and custom REST endpoints, you can build pretty much anything â€” from lightweight landing pages to full-scale web apps. WordPress isnâ€™t dead. Itâ€™s evolving. The community has matured, the tech stack is more flexible than ever, and when used right, itâ€™s incredibly powerful. So before writing it off, take a look at how the best in the industry are pushing it to the next level. Check out this list of the top WordPress development companies to see how itâ€™s done.

entry.title: Short tale of how frontends and backends talk
entry.summary: A Day at the Backend Embassy Once upon a time in Webland, there was a grand building called the Backend Embassy. This building held all the secrets and data of a powerful kingdom â€” services, user data, currency prices â€” everything. But it wasnâ€™t open to just anyone. Out front, a friendly but strict API Secretary sat behind a reception desk. She managed all the requests, deciding who could go in and what they could ask for. Now, our hero â€” a curious Frontend Developer â€” wanted to get some information. He didnâ€™t want to go through a backend server of his own; instead, he sent a request straight from his Frontend App, running right out of his browser in the village of http://localhost:5173. When the messenger arrived at the Backend Embassy, the CORS Guard stepped in. â€œHold on,â€ said the CORS Guard. â€œWhere are you from?â€ http://localhost:5173â€™?â€ The secretary checked the papers and shook her head. â€œNope. The API didnâ€™t mention them.â€ The frontend developer scratched his head. â€œSo I canâ€™t talk to the API directly from the browser unless they trust me?â€ â€œHey, can you go talk to the API Secretary on my behalf? The CORS Guard doesnâ€™t block backend servers.â€ The backend agreed. It passed through the gate easily, retrieved the data, and brought it back to the frontend. The frontend now had what it needed â€” by going through a trusted backend proxy :)))))) Moral of the Story: CORS is a browser rule enforced by a security guard between frontend and backend. The browser checks if the API allows the origin. If not, the response is blocked â€” even if it's sent."

entry.title: Local Whisper & VoIP PBX: Why Maryrose Whittaker Sees On-Prem as the Privacy Linchpin
entry.summary: We're seeing AI, particularly Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), weave its way into almost every corner of tech. VoIP PBX systems, the backbone of modern business communication, are no exception. From transcribing voicemails to analyzing call sentiment, the potential is huge. OpenAI's Whisper model, known for its accuracy and multilingual capabilities, is a popular choice. But as Maryrose Whittaker points out, integrating ASR into sensitive communication systems like PBXs raises significant data privacy concerns. While cloud-based ASR APIs offer convenience, they often mean sending potentially sensitive voice dataâ€”customer calls, internal strategy discussions, HR mattersâ€”to third-party servers. This is where Whittaker argues that local installations of Whisper are not just an alternative,â€¦

entry.title: Day 9/ 30 Days of Linux Mastery: Special Permissions (SUID, SGID, Sticky Bit)
entry.summary:
Table of Contents
Introduction What Are Special Permissions? Core Special Permission Commands Real-World Scenario: Special Permissions in a Cloud Project Conclusion Let's Connect
Welcome back to Day 9 of our Linux journey! Over here, we are learning by doing every single day. Todayâ€™s focus? Special permissions: They are powerful tools that give extra control over files and directories in multi-user systems. Understanding how these permissions work can help you manage user behavior securely and professionally.
In Linux, we know basic file permissions (rwx). But special permissions go a level deeper. They include: SUID (Set User ID)
SGID (Set Group ID)
Sticky Bit
1. SUID: Run as the File Owner
Use case: You want a regular user to run a script with the permissions of thâ€¦

Take a simple example: when I want to host an application I've built, I usually have two options: Set up a CI/CD pipeline (for example, using GitHub Actions), which requires configuring SSH keys, private access options, environment variables, and adapting pipelines as configurations evolve. Or use self-hosting tools â€¦

entry.title: Disabling ApplicationInsights' deprecated unload event listener in Angular
entry.summary: When using default Application Insights on your Angular page, Chrome Lighthouse flags unload-event listeners as deprecated (they block the back/forward cache and degrade UX12). In this post we'll explore why this matters, why unload is deprecated, what the ApplicationInsights client does by default and how to use it properly You might ask yourself: why does this matter? Browsers are moving away from the legacy unload event because it breaks the back/forward cache (bfcache), an in-memory snapshot that makes â€œbackâ€/â€œforwardâ€ navigations nearly instant. Any page with an unload listener is ineligible for bfcache, slowing down users when they navigate away and then return13. Chromeâ€™s Deprecation Timeline Starting Chrome 115 you can opt out of delivering unload to handlers; Chrome 117+ will deâ€¦

entry.title: CBDCs â€˜costly fiat copyâ€™, not fintech success so far: Ex-Binance exec
entry.summary: The United Statesâ€™ rejection of a central bank digital currency has not halted the progress of CBDCs globally, but their success has been questionable so far, according to a former Binance executive. Global CBDC projects have not failed, but they have also not become what they were anticipated to be, according to Olga Goncharova, CEO at the consulting firm Rizz Go and former director of government relations in the Commonwealth of Independent States at Binance. â€œCBDCs were conceived as a technological breakthrough, but so far they look like expensive imitations of existing traditional fiat currencies that citizens and businesses already use through online banking and payment apps,â€ Goncharova told Cointelegraph at the Blockchain Forum in Moscow. Olga Goncharova during a panel on Web3 geopolâ€¦

entry.title: Your digital identity got stolen â€” Now what?
entry.summary:
What is digital identity?
Your digital identity is the fingerprint you leave across the internet, a living map of who you are. Your digital identity is more than just your name or email; it stretches from your social media profiles and crypto wallet addresses to your device fingerprints and even the rhythms of your daily browsing habits. In the fast-moving world of cryptocurrency, where identity and financial access often overlap, digital identity theft isnâ€™t just a nuisance; itâ€™s an open door to your assets.Â
Without strong protection, even small pieces of stolen information can be stitched into a full profile, giving cybercriminals everything they need to impersonate you, seize your funds or lock you out of your accounts. What many donâ€™t realizeâ€¦

entry.title: Loopscale recovers $2.8M after weekend DeFi hack and bounty talks
entry.summary: DeFi protocol Loopscale has recovered nearly half of the funds stolen during a major exploit over the weekend, as white hat negotiations with the attacker show signs of progress. In an April 29 update posted to X, Loopscale confirmed that approximately 19,463 Wrapped SOL (WSOL) (worth roughly $2.88 million) have been returned to its wallets since April 28. The first two returns included 10,000 WSOL (~$1.48 million) and 4,463 WSOL (~$660,000), following an earlier recovery of 5,000 WSOL (~$740,000). â€œOur pursuit of an amicable resolution regarding Saturdayâ€™s incident continues to make progress,â€ the team wrote. What is the Paws Telegram Mini App?
Paws is a Telegram-based Mini App created by the same team behind other projects, such as Notcoin and Dogs.Â If youâ€™ve been cruising around Telegram lately, chances are youâ€™ve stumbled upon Paws, the viral crypto Mini App thatâ€™s got everyone tapping, clicking and inviting their friends like itâ€™s 2010 FarmVille all over again.Â Originally launched in October 2024 on The Open Network (TON) blockchain, Paws exploded in popularity with its ultra-simple tap-to-earn concept. Think of it as a gamified rewards engine embedded directly in Telegram, where users rack up points by completing tasks, referring others and interacting with mini-game elements.Â Within just eight days of going live, Paws pulled in over 20 million â€¦

entry.title: 1inch launches on Solana with crosschain swaps in the pipeline
entry.summary: Decentralized exchange (DEX) aggregator 1inch has launched on Solana, marking a significant step toward its vision of a â€œunified multichainâ€ decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem. According to a press release shared with Cointelegraph, the integration enables users to trade over 1 million Solana-based tokens directly through the 1inch decentralized application (DApp), benefiting from maximal extractable value-protected swaps, optimized rates and open-source smart contract infrastructure. The move brings 1inchâ€™s Fusion protocol to Solana for the first time. Fusion enables users to define their ideal swap parameters, which are then executed by competing professional market makers, or â€œresolvers,â€ using Dutch auction mechanics. Combined with Solanaâ€™s ultra-fast block times, the setup promiseâ€¦

entry.summary: The concept of a Russian ruble stablecoin received special attention at a major local crypto event, the Blockchain Forum in Moscow, with key industry executives reflecting on some of the core features a ruble-backed stablecoin might require. Sergey Mendeleev, founder of the digital settlement exchange Exved and inactive founder of the sanctioned Garantex exchange, put forward seven key criteria for a potential â€œreplica of Tetherâ€ in a keynote at the Blockchain Forum on April 23. Mendeleev said a potential ruble stablecoin must have untraceable transactions and allow transfers without Know Your Customer (KYC) checks. However, because one of the criteria also requires the stablecoin to comply with Russian regulations, he expressed skepticism that such a product could emerge soon. The DAI modâ€¦

Abu Dhabiâ€™s sovereign wealth fund ADQ, the United Arab Emiratesâ€™ largest bank, First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB), and the massive conglomerate the International Holding Company, have partnered to launch the stablecoin, pending regulatory approval, the three companies said on April 28. The trio said the stablecoin would be regulated by the UAEâ€™s central bank and backed by the countryâ€™s currency, the dirham. entry.title: Bankera founders used ICO funds on global property buys: Report
entry.summary: The founders of the crypto fintech firm Bankera used funds from the projectâ€™s 2018 initial coin offering to purchase luxury properties worldwide, according to a report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. The OCCRP reported on April 28, citing leaked company records and bank statements, that nearly half of the funds from Bankeraâ€™s 100 million euro ($114 million) ICO were transferred to a bank in the Pacific Island country of Vanuatu that was purchased by the projectâ€™s founders, Vytautas KaraleviÄius, Justas Dobiliauskas and Mantas MockeviÄius. Soon after, the Vanuatu bank reportedly began issuing millions of euros in loans to companies owned by the trio to build a luxury real estate portfolio â€” including a villa in the French Riviera and high-end property in Lithuania, â€¦

entry.title: Zurich Uniâ€™s secret AI experiment manipulated Redditorsâ€™ opinions
entry.summary: Researchers at the University of Zurich have been accused of undertaking an unauthorized four-month-long experiment on a Reddit board using artificial intelligence-generated comments to test whether AI could alter peopleâ€™s opinions.Â As part of the experiment, AI-powered accounts faked a variety of personas, including a rape victim, a person opposed to specific social movements and a trauma counselor specializing in abuse, moderators of the r/changemyview subreddit said in an April 26 post. â€œOur sub is a decidedly human space that rejects undisclosed AI as a core value,â€ the moderators said. â€œPeople do not come here to discuss their views with AI or to be experimented upon.â€Â The researchers used AI to generate responses but attempted to personalize the replies based on information from thâ€¦

entry.summary: US federal prosecutors and the co-founders of the crypto mixer Samourai Wallet have asked a court for more time to consider potentially dismissing the case after the Justice Department rolled back its crypto enforcement. Lawyers for Samourai Wallet CEO Keonne Rodriguez and chief technology officer William Hill said in an April 28 letter to Manhattan federal judge Richard Berman that they jointly requested with the government â€œfor a continuance of the pretrial motions schedule by 16 days.â€ The Samourai executives' lawyers said on April 10 that they wrote to Acting Manhattan US Attorney Jay Clayton to request the dismissal of the case after an April 7 memo from Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche shuttered the Justice Departmentâ€™s crypto team. â€œOn April 24, 2025, defense counsel met with thâ€¦

entry.title: US dollar facing growing competition for stablecoin dominance: Tether co-founder
entry.summary: While United States dollar-denominated stablecoins dominate the stablecoin and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization game, other competitors are coming into play, according to Tether co-founder Reeve Collins.Â Speaking to Cointelegraph in Dubai, Collins said that while dollar-backed stablecoins may be dominant, other currencies and assets may compete to back stablecoins. â€œThe stablecoin definitely helps preserve the dollar dominance, especially in the crypto space,â€ Collins said. â€œThe dollar is kind of the reserve currency of crypto. But now there are other currencies coming into play. But more importantly, itâ€™s not currencies. Itâ€™s other types of backing,â€ he added. Collins said that other assets used to back stablecoins may compete with US dollars by bringing a higher yield to users.Â Inteâ€¦

entry.title: Ray Dalio says global monetary order â€˜on the brinkâ€™ of breakdown
entry.summary: Legendary investor Ray Dalio has said the world is â€œon the brinkâ€ of the global monetary order breaking down, which is being accelerated by the Trump administrationâ€™s tariff disruptions. The trade tensions are fracturing the monetary, political and international world orders by fueling deglobalization and unsustainable trade imbalances, Dalio, the former CEO of hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, said in an April 28 X post. Dalio added that this is leading to irreversible damage, and an increasing number of importers and exporters, particularly between the US and China, are drastically reducing interdependencies and â€œmaking alternative plans.â€ â€œ[Theyâ€™re] recognizing that whatever happens with tariffs, these problems won't go away, and that radically reduced interdependencies with the US is â€¦

entry.title: Crypto group asks Trump to end prosecution of crypto devs, Roman Storm
entry.summary: The crypto lobby group, the DeFi Education Fund, has petitioned the Trump administration to end what it claimed was the â€œlawless prosecutionâ€ of open-source software developers, including Roman Storm, a creator of the crypto mixing service Tornado Cash. In an April 28 letter to White House crypto czar David Sacks, the group urged President Donald Trump â€œto take immediate action to discontinue the Biden-era Department of Justice's lawless campaign to criminalize open-source software development.â€Â The letter specifically mentioned the prosecution of Storm, who was charged in August 2023 with helping launder over $1 billion in crypto through Tornado Cash. His trial is still set for July, and his fellow charged co-founder, Roman Semenov, is at large and believed to be in Russia. The DeFi Educâ€¦

entry.title: Mastercard links with Circle, Paxos for merchant stablecoin payments
entry.summary: Mastercard says it will allow merchants across its network to be paid with stablecoins in a partnership with payment processor Nuvei and stablecoin issuers Circle and Paxos.Â Through the venture, 150 million merchants across the Mastercard network will now have the option to receive payments in stablecoins, regardless of how a customer pays, Mastercard said on April 28. The payments giant also partnered with crypto exchange OKX for a crypto-enabled bank card, which Mastercard product chief Jorn Lambert said creates a â€œ360-degree approachâ€ where consumers can spend stablecoins and merchants can receive them. He added that the â€œmainstream use cases are clearâ€ for blockchain tech, and the company wanted â€œto make it as easy for merchants to receive stablecoin payments and for consumers to use â€¦

entry.title: Ethereum Foundation shuffles leadership, splits board and management
entry.summary: The Ethereum Foundation, which backs the development of the Ethereum blockchain, has overhauled its leadership structure to separate the responsibilities of its management team and board of directors. The board will act as the â€œsecurity council to protect the heart and soulâ€ of the foundation and set visions for Ethereum, while the new management will be focused on the strategic and operational execution of those visions, the Foundation said in an April 28 blog post. It added in an April 28 X post that Hsiao-Wei Wang and Tomasz K. StaÅ„czak were appointed as co-executive directors on March 2 to deliver on those visions â€” which are centered around championing censorship resistance, open-source innovation, privacy and security Wang and StaÅ„czakâ€™s roles took effect on April 28 with the foundatâ€¦

entry.title: Why is Bitcoin price stuck?
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Bitcoin gained 10% over the past week, but overhead resistance continues to obstruct a rally to $100,000.
Bitcoin (BTC) displayed strength as the week opened on April 28, up 10% over the last seven days to trade at $95,500. Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and Bitstamp shows that BTC price has been suppressed under $100,000 since early February, as shown in the chart below. BTC/USD weekly chart. Cointelegraph/TradingView Bitcoin lacks a $100K catalyst The BTC/USD pair rallied 30% from its $74,400 low reached on April 7 to trade above $95,000, a recovery fueled largely by easing US-China tariff tensions. Although the rally has been accompanied by $3.06 billion in spot ETF inflows, there are doubts whether that is enough to break Bitcoin out of consolidation.Â In its lateâ€¦

entry.title: MetaMask to launch self-custody crypto card with Mastercard
entry.summary: Wallet provider MetaMask is launching a crypto payments card that will allow users to spend self-custodied funds, offering crypto holders additional ways to use their tokens. The new card is backed by Mastercard and is being developed in partnership with CompoSecure and Baanx, according to the company. The product uses smart contracts to execute the IRL (In Real Life) transactions, with a processing speed under five seconds. It operates on the Linea network, a layer-2 scaling solution on Ethereum. The companies marketed the self-custodied crypto card as an alternative to the potential risks associated with centralized exchanges. In February, the second-largest crypto exchange by volume, Bybit, was hacked for $1.4 billion, an event that sparked widespread consternation in the crypto space. â€¦
